data.title: Meet our team in Charleston
data.meta_description: Banking, mortgage, and investment solutions to reach your full potential.
data.text:
Reid Boehm

Market Executive

South Coastal Region

Reid first joined Synovus in 2013, after graduating from Auburn University with a B.S. in Business Administration and Management. Before being appointed as market executive of the South Coastal Region in 2020, he served as vice president and commercial banker in the area. Reid loves working with Synovus because of the people: both colleagues and customers. He feels surrounded by family in the office and values his involvement in his customers’ lives. He has been honored in the Synovus Chairman’s Circle of Excellence in 2015, 2016, 2017, 2018, and 2019.

Reid lives in Mount Pleasant, SC, with his wife Josie and their two dogs. In his free time, Reid can be found on the Wando River, watching college football, traveling, or spending time with family and friends.

Work in our community

Charleston Metro Chamber of Commerce Board of Directors

American Heart Association Executive Leadership Committee

South Carolina Young Bankers Association Board of Directors

Steering Committee member of Charleston Young Professionals

Leadership Charleston Class of 2019

South Carolina Banker’s School

Charleston Metro Chamber of Commerce

Jarred Overcash

Regional Retail Sales Manager

South Carolina

Jarred joined Synovus in 2018 bringing 20 years of banking experience with him. He earned a Business Administration and Management degree from the College of Charleston, where he also played baseball. Jarred is motivated by building effective relationships with everyone in the industry, whether competitor, customer, peer, team member, direct report or prospect. He has been successful at coaching his team to a high performance of helping customers reach their financial goals. When not working, Jarred enjoys fishing, family beach trips and supporting his 4 daughters’ athletic activities.

Work in our community

Graduate of Leadership Charleston 2014

Graduate of the SC Bankers School 2019

Series 6 & 63 licensed and SC Life and Health

Volunteer and Supporter, United Way Organizations

Member, Charleston Chamber of Commerce

Member, College of Charleston Enactus

Volunteer and Supporter, American Cancer Society

Volunteer Baseball Coach Bishop England High School 2001-2004

Jason Christopher

Private Wealth Advisor

A native South Carolinian, Jason has 12 years of experience in the banking industry. Before joining Synovus, he was an Assistant Vice President Branch Manager, Vice President Retail Sales Manager, and Vice President Private/Premier Relationship Banker with First Citizens Bank. Jason earned a Bachelor’s in Business Administration, from Furman University, in Greenville, SC. He has FINRA Series 7 and Series 66 licenses, and is licensed in S.C. as an Accident and Health Insurance Producer.

In his free time, he is an avid runner.

Work in our community

Graduate of Leadership Charleston with the Charleston Chamber of Commerce

Volunteer with United Way Organizations and Former Loaned Officer

Volunteer with Meals On Wheels

William Quantz

Wholesale Relationship Manager

William joined Synovus in 2018 with more than 25 years of experience in the banking industry. Originally from New Orleans, William completed his undergraduate education at the University of Virginia before earning a Masters degree in International Business from the University of South Carolina. He joined Synovus because he appreciates that it is a large enough bank to offer a wide variety of products and services but still small enough to focus on relationships and community. William enjoys providing proactive and creative advice to his clients to help them achieve their goals.

He is married with one son. In his free time, he likes playing golf, spending time with his family, walking their dog, and cooking and grilling on the Big Green Egg.

Work in our community

Palmetto Scholars Foundation, Board Secretary, 2020 to present

Rotary Club of North Charleston, 2010 to present

South Carolina Economic Developers Association, 2012 to present

Palmetto Scholars Academy, Board Treasurer, 2016-2018

Charleston Metro Chamber of Commerce Board, 2017-2018

Berkeley Chamber of Commerce Board, 2010-2011

Matthew Nodtvedt

Senior Director, Alternative Energy Banking

For Matthew P. Nodtvedt, banking is a rewarding and noble profession. “So much depends on our ability to allocate capital responsibly. Our communities thrive when we do it effectively,” he says. He knows that with access to the right financial resources and knowledge, people can accomplish amazing things. “It’s both exciting and humbling to contribute towards the achievement of someone’s goals,” he says. “Charleston is a remarkable place and I’m grateful for the opportunity to make a career in the long-term economic success of my hometown.” This lifelong resident of the Lowcountry was raised on Isle of Palms and attended Porter-Gaud School and Clemson University. He relocated back to Charleston in 2009, where he has been a commercial banker ever since. A graduate of the ABA Stonier Graduate School of Banking at The University of Pennsylvania (where he also earned the Leadership Certificate from The Wharton School’s Aresty Institute of Executive Education), he resides in Mt. Pleasant with his wife, two children and dog.

Banking products are provided by Synovus Bank, Member FDIC. Synovus Bank, NMLS #408043, is an Equal Housing Lender.

Synovus Bank, Member FDIC, is an Equal Housing Lender and lends in the states of Alabama, Georgia, Florida, Tennessee, North Carolina, and South Carolina. This communication is directed to properties in those states. Loans subject to approval including credit approval. Synovus Bank, NMLS #408043.

If you would like to assert there has been an error made with the servicing of your consumer mortgage loan, or if you would like to request information about the servicing of your consumer mortgage loan, and if you would like your assertion or request to be treated in accordance with the procedures provided in 12 C.F.R. Parts 1024.35 and 1024.36, then you must send written notice to us at Synovus Bank, Attention: Mortgage Customer Service, 800 Shades Creek Parkway, MS 130, Birmingham, AL 35209. Otherwise, we will treat your assertion or request per our standard policies and procedures.

You have certain rights under Federal law related to resolving errors and requesting information about your mortgage account, and you may learn more about your rights by contacting Synovus Bank, or by visiting https://www.consumerfinance.gov/mortgage/

Investment products and services provided by Synovus are offered through Synovus Securities, Inc. (SSI) a registered Broker-Dealer, member FINRA/SIPC and SEC registered Investment Advisor, Synovus Trust Company, N.A. (STC) and Creative Financial Group, a division of SSI. Trust services for Synovus are provided by STC.

NOT FDIC INSURED

NO BANK GUARANTEE

MAY LOSE VALUE

SSI is a subsidiary of Synovus Financial Corp. and an affiliate of Synovus Bank, and STC is a subsidiary of Synovus Bank. You can obtain more information about SSI and its Registered Representatives by accessing BrokerCheck.

Approval of any bank product or service is not contingent upon purchasing insurance from Synovus Bank. Insurance products marketed through Synovus and its affiliated companies are underwritten by insurance companies not affiliated with Synovus.
